Semester Topic: Nonviolence and violence in anti-colonial struggles in India, Afghanistan, Pakistan and the US South
This course focuses on nonviolent strategies for social change as pioneered by Mahatma Gandhi. It focuses on the history of anti-colonial struggles for freedom in Afghanistan, India, Pakistan, Bangladesh and the US struggle against racial injustice.  The course anlyzes the religious and political roots of nonviolence. It will have a special focus on Afghanistan, from Abdul Ghaffar Khan (a colleague of Gandhi, who organized a nonviolence army among  Afghans) to the Taliban in an effort to understand the USA's longest war.
course_description: This course introduces you to the complexities of Gandhi's thought and his political action, his spiritual heights and his idiosyncrasies. We will read Gandhi's own writings, which include his autobiography, his Hind Swaraj, and several seminal articles from his journal Harijan.
